availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Ephraim Faris Hays (Pulaski County, Kentucky, laborer and soldier.)

body.p: Pulaski County, Kentucky, laborer and soldier. Pulaski County, Kentucky, native. Son of Charles Hays and Pamelia Hays. Resident of Pulaski County in 1850. Laborer in Pulaski County in 1860. Served in the 12th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a first lieutenant and adjutant from September 26, 1861 to September 25, 1864. Mustered out on September 25, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pulaski County, Division 2, p. 80B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pulaski County, Somerset, p. 158.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0256.
"Ephraim F. Hays (1839-1905)," Find A Grave, Memorial #12410730, accessed July 21, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/12410730.
